onlineAddresses.caption: Book: "The Weekend that Changed Wall Street"
LA Times: "How I Made It: Maria Bartiromo’s stock has risen at FOX"
Book: The Cost: Trump, China, and American Revival
How Maria Bartiromo Became One of the Most Influential Journalists in Business

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Maria Bartiromo is the Global Markets Editor for Mornings with Maria and on FOX Business Network.
  • She also anchors Mornings with Maria, Wall Street, FBN’s weekly primetime investing program, and Sunday Morning Futures, the most watched Sunday morning program on cable.
  • When Bartiromo moderated FOX’s 2015-2016 Republican presidential primary debates, they became the highest-rated programs in network history.
  • She has covered business and the economy for more than 25 years and was one of the building blocks of business cable network CNBC.
  • Bartiromo has received numerous prestigious awards, including two Emmy's and a Gracie Award.
  • The Financial Times named her one of the “50 Faces That Shaped the Decade,” and she was the first female journalist to be inducted into the Cable Hall of Fame.
  • Bartiromo is the author of several books, including The Cost: Trump, China, and American Revival and has been published in the Financial Times, Newsweek, Town and Country, Registered Rep, and the New York Post.

speakerBiography.text:
Maria Bartiromo is the anchor of Fox News’ public affairs program, Sunday Morning Futures, on Fox News Channel (10 AM/ET), the top-rated Sunday morning program on cable. She is also the anchor and global markets editor of Mornings with Maria (Monday to Friday 6-9 AM/ET) on Fox Business Network (FBN) and Maria Bartiromo’s Wall Street, FBN’s weekly primetime investing program (Fridays at 7 PM/ET).

Bartiromo has been a pioneer in her industry. In 1995, she became the first journalist to report live from the floor of the New York Stock Exchange on a daily basis. She has covered business and the economy for more than 30 years and was one of the building blocks of business cable network CNBC. Honors include two Emmys and a Gracie Award. In 2009, the Financial Times named Bartiromo one of the "50 Faces That Shaped the Decade." She was the first female journalist inducted into the Cable Hall of Fame and she has moderated three presidential debates.

Bartiromo is the author of several books, including The Cost: Trump, China, and American Revival, co-written by Maria Bartiromo and James Freeman of the Wall Street Journal, published in 2020 by Threshold Editions, an imprint of Simon & Schuster.

She has also written weekly columns for Business Week and Milano Finanza magazines; as well as monthly columns for USA Today, and Individual Investor, Ticker, and Reader’s Digest magazines. She has been published in the Financial Times, Newsweek, Town and Country, Registered Rep, and the New York Post.

speakerBioQuote.text: Bartiromo has been a pioneer in her industry.

speakerNameSubheading.text: Emmy Award-Winning News Anchor, FOX Business Network

speakerReview.text: Maria was wonderful to work with. She did a great job with the interviews as she had to discuss finance with the CEO of Golden Sachs and the world events with General Petraeus. Her depth of knowledge is amazing.
speakerReview.title: SPEAKER REVIEW
